enum.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT
enum.description: Micro air vehicle / autopilot classes. This identifies the individual model.

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC
entry.description: Generic autopilot, full support for everything

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot only supporting simple waypoints

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_WAYPOINTS_AND_SIMPLE_NAVIGATION_ONLY
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting waypoints and other simple navigation commands

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_GENERIC_MISSION_FULL
entry.description: Generic autopilot supporting the full mission command set

entry.name: MAV_AUTOPILOT_INVALID
entry.description: No valid autopilot, e.g. a GCS or other MAVLink component

entry.name: MAV_TYPE_GCS
entry.description: Operator control unit / ground control station

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG
enum.description: These flags encode the MAV mode.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_SAFETY_ARMED
entry.description: 0b10000000 MAV safety set to armed. Motors are enabled / running / can start. Ready to fly.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_HIL_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00100000 hardware in the loop simulation. All motors / actuators are blocked, but internal software is full operational.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_STABILIZE_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00010000 system stabilizes electronically its attitude (and optionally position). It needs however further control inputs to move around.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_GUIDED_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00001000 guided mode enabled, system flies MISSIONs / mission items.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_AUTO_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000100 autonomous mode enabled, system finds its own goal positions. Guided flag can be set or not, depends on the actual implementation.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_TEST_ENABLED
entry.description: 0b00000010 system has a test mode enabled. This flag is intended for temporary system tests and should not be used for stable implementations.

enum.name: MAV_MODE_FLAG_DECODE_POSITION
enum.description: These values encode the bit positions of the decode position. These values can be used to read the value of a flag bit by combining the base_mode variable with AND with the flag position value. The result will be either 0 or 1, depending on if the flag is set or not.

enum.name: MAV_GOTO
enum.description: Override command, pauses current mission execution and moves immediately to a position

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE
entry.description: Continue with the next item in mission execution.

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION
entry.description: Hold at the current position of the system

entry.name: MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION
entry.description: Hold at the position specified in the parameters of the DO_HOLD action

enum.name: MAV_MODE
enum.description: These defines are predefined OR-combined mode flags. There is no need to use values from this enum, but it simplifies the use of the mode flags. Note that manual input is enabled in all modes as a safety override.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_PREFLIGHT
entry.description: System is not ready to fly, booting, calibrating, etc. No flag is set.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_STABILIZE_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under assisted RC control.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MODE_MANUAL_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under manual (RC) control, no stabilization

entry.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint

entry.name: MAV_MODE_GUIDED_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control, manual setpoint

entry.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_DISARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by MISSIONs)

entry.name: MAV_MODE_AUTO_ARMED
entry.description: System is allowed to be active, under autonomous control and navigation (the trajectory is decided onboard and not pre-programmed by MISSIONs)

entry.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_DISARMED
entry.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only.

entry.name: MAV_MODE_TEST_ARMED
entry.description: UNDEFINED mode. This solely depends on the autopilot - use with caution, intended for developers only.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CALIBRATING
entry.description: System is calibrating and not flight-ready.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_STANDBY
entry.description: System is grounded and on standby. It can be launched any time.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_ACTIVE
entry.description: System is active and might be already airborne. Motors are engaged.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_CRITICAL
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It can however still navigate.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is in a non-normal flight mode. It lost control over parts or over the whole airframe. It is in mayday and going down.

entry.name: MAV_STATE_POWEROFF
entry.description: System just initialized its power-down sequence, will shut down now.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL
entry.description: Global coordinate frame, WGS84 coordinate system. First value / x: latitude, second value / y: longitude, third value / z: positive altitude over mean sea level (MSL)

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED
entry.description: Local coordinate frame, Z-up (x: north, y: east, z: down).

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_MISSION
entry.description: NOT a coordinate frame, indicates a mission command.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL_RELATIVE_ALT
entry.description: Global coordinate frame, WGS84 coordinate system, relative altitude over ground with respect to the home position. First value / x: latitude, second value / y: longitude, third value / z: positive altitude with 0 being at the altitude of the home location.

entry.name: MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_ENU
entry.description: Local coordinate frame, Z-down (x: east, y: north, z: up)

enum.name: MAV_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_WAYPOINT
entry.param: Hold time in decimal seconds. (ignored by fixed wing, time to stay at MISSION for rotary wing)
Acceptance radius in meters (if the sphere with this radius is hit, the MISSION counts as reached)
0 to pass through the WP, if > 0 radius in meters to pass by WP. Positive value for clockwise orbit, negative value for counter-clockwise orbit. Allows trajectory control.
Desired yaw angle at MISSION (rotary wing)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_UNLIM
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION an unlimited amount of time
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TURNS
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION for X turns
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LOITER_TIME
entry.description: Loiter around this MISSION for X seconds
entry.param: Radius around MISSION, in meters. If positive loiter clockwise, else counter-clockwise

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_TAKEOFF
entry.param: Minimum pitch (if airspeed sensor present), desired pitch without sensor
Yaw angle (if magnetometer present), ignored without magnetometer

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI
entry.description: Sets the region of interest (ROI) for a sensor set or the vehicle itself. This can then be used by the vehicles control system to control the vehicle attitude and the attitude of various sensors such as cameras.
entry.param: Region of intereset mode. (see MAV_ROI enum)
MISSION index/ target ID. (see MAV_ROI enum)
ROI index (allows a vehicle to manage multiple ROI's)
x the location of the fixed ROI (see MAV_FRAME)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_PATHPLANNING
entry.description: Control autonomous path planning on the MAV.
entry.param: 0: Disable local obstacle avoidance / local path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable local path planning, 2: Enable and reset local path planning
0: Disable full path planning (without resetting map), 1: Enable, 2: Enable and reset map/occupancy grid, 3: Enable and reset planned route, but not occupancy grid
Yaw angle at goal, in compass degrees, [0..360]

entry.name: MAV_CMD_NAV_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the NAV/ACTION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_CHANGE_ALT
entry.description: Ascend/descend at rate. Delay mission state machine until desired altitude reached.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_DISTANCE
entry.description: Delay mission state machine until within desired distance of next NAV point.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_YAW
entry.param: speed during yaw change:[deg per second]
direction: negative: counter clockwise, positive: clockwise [-1,1]

entry.name: MAV_CMD_CONDITION_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the CONDITION commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_MODE
entry.param: Mode, as defined by ENUM MAV_MODE

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JUMP
entry.description: Jump to the desired command in the mission list. Repeat this action only the specified number of times

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED
entry.description: Change speed and/or throttle set points.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_HOME
entry.description: Changes the home location either to the current location or a specified location.
entry.param: Use current (1=use current location, 0=use specified location)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_PARAMETER
entry.description: Set a system parameter. Caution! Use of this command requires knowledge of the numeric enumeration value of the parameter.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_RELAY
entry.description: Set a relay to a condition.
entry.param: Setting (1=on, 0=off, others possible depending on system hardware)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_RELAY
entry.description: Cycle a relay on and off for a desired number of cyles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_SERVO
entry.description: Set a servo to a desired PWM value.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_REPEAT_SERVO
entry.description: Cycle a between its nominal setting and a desired PWM for a desired number of cycles with a desired period.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_CONTROL_VIDEO
entry.param: Transmission: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw
Transmission mode: 0: video stream, >0: single images every n seconds (decimal)
Recording: 0: disabled, 1: enabled compressed, 2: enabled raw

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_LAST
entry.description: NOP - This command is only used to mark the upper limit of the DO commands in the enumeration

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_CALIBRATION
entry.description: Trigger calibration. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_SET_SENSOR_OFFSETS
entry.description: Set sensor offsets. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Sensor to adjust the offsets for: 0: gyros, 1: accelerometer, 2: magnetometer, 3: barometer, 4: optical flow
X axis offset (or generic dimension 1), in the sensor's raw units
Y axis offset (or generic dimension 2), in the sensor's raw units
Z axis offset (or generic dimension 3), in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 4, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 5, in the sensor's raw units
Generic dimension 6, in the sensor's raw units

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_STORAGE
entry.description: Request storage of different parameter values and logs. This command will be only accepted if in pre-flight mode.
entry.param: Parameter storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM
Mission storage: 0: READ FROM FLASH/EEPROM, 1: WRITE CURRENT TO FLASH/EEPROM

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PREFLIGHT_REBOOT_SHUTDOWN
entry.description: Request the reboot or shutdown of system components.
entry.param: 0: Do nothing for autopilot, 1: Reboot autopilot, 2: Shutdown autopilot.
0: Do nothing for onboard computer, 1: Reboot onboard computer, 2: Shutdown onboard computer.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_OVERRIDE_GOTO
entry.param: MAV_GOTO_DO_HOLD: hold MAV_GOTO_DO_CONTINUE: continue with next item in mission plan
MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_CURRENT_POSITION: Hold at current position MAV_GOTO_HOLD_AT_SPECIFIED_POSITION: hold at specified position
MAV_FRAME coordinate frame of hold point

entry.name: MAV_CMD_MISSION_START
entry.param: first_item: the first mission item to run
last_item: the last mission item to run (after this item is run, the mission ends)

enum.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM
enum.description: Data stream IDs. A data stream is not a fixed set of messages, but rather a recommendation to the autopilot software. Individual autopilots may or may not obey the recommended messages.

enum.name: MAV_ROI
enum.description: The ROI (region of interest) for the vehicle. This can be be used by the vehicle for camera/vehicle attitude alignment (see MAV_CMD_NAV_ROI).

enum.name: MAV_CMD_ACK
enum.description: ACK / NACK / ERROR values as a result of MAV_CMDs and for mission item transmission.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_FAIL
entry.description: Generic error message if none of the other reasons fails or if no detailed error reporting is implemented.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_ACCESS_DENIED
entry.description: The system is refusing to accept this command from this source / communication partner.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: Command or mission item is not supported, other commands would be accepted.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_COORDINATE_FRAME_NOT_SUPPORTED
entry.description: The coordinate frame of this command / mission item is not supported.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_COORDINATES_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The coordinate frame of this command is ok, but he coordinate values exceed the safety limits of this system. This is a generic error, please use the more specific error messages below if possible.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_X_LAT_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The X or latitude value is out of range.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_Y_LON_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The Y or longitude value is out of range.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ACK_ERR_Z_ALT_OUT_OF_RANGE
entry.description: The Z or altitude value is out of range.

enum.name: MAV_PARAM_TYPE
enum.description: Specifies the datatype of a MAVLink parameter.

enum.name: MAV_MISSION_RESULT
enum.description: result in a mavlink mission ack

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_ERROR
entry.description: generic error / not accepting mission commands at all right now

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_INVALID
entry.description: one of the parameters has an invalid value

entry.name: MAV_MISSION_DENIED
entry.description: not accepting any mission commands from this communication partner

enum.name: MAV_SEVERITY
enum.description: Indicates the severity level, generally used for status messages to indicate their relative urgency. Based on RFC-5424 using expanded definitions at: http://www.kiwisyslog.com/kb/info:-syslog-message-levels/.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_EMERGENCY
entry.description: System is unusable. This is a "panic" condition.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ALERT
entry.description: Action should be taken immediately. Indicates error in non-critical systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_CRITICAL
entry.description: Action must be taken immediately. Indicates failure in a primary system.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_ERROR
entry.description: Indicates an error in secondary/redundant systems.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_WARNING
entry.description: Indicates about a possible future error if this is not resolved within a given timeframe. Example would be a low battery warning.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_NOTICE
entry.description: An unusual event has occured, though not an error condition. This should be investigated for the root cause.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_INFO
entry.description: Normal operational messages. Useful for logging. No action is required for these messages.

entry.name: MAV_SEVERITY_DEBUG
entry.description: Useful non-operational messages that can assist in debugging. These should not occur during normal operation.

message.name: HEARTBEAT
message.description: The heartbeat message shows that a system is present and responding. The type of the MAV and Autopilot hardware allow the receiving system to treat further messages from this system appropriate (e.g. by laying out the user interface based on the autopilot).
message.field: Type of the MAV (quadrotor, helicopter, etc., up to 15 types, defined in MAV_TYPE ENUM)
Autopilot type / class. defined in MAV_AUTOPILOT ENUM
System mode bitfield, see MAV_MODE_FLAGS ENUM in mavlink/include/mavlink_types.h
A bitfield for use for autopilot-specific flags.
System status flag, see MAV_STATE ENUM
MAVLink version, not writable by user, gets added by protocol because of magic data type: uint8_t_mavlink_version

message.name: SYS_STATUS
message.description: The general system state. If the system is following the MAVLink standard, the system state is mainly defined by three orthogonal states/modes: The system mode, which is either LOCKED (motors shut down and locked), MANUAL (system under RC control), GUIDED (system with autonomous position control, position setpoint controlled manually) or AUTO (system guided by path/waypoint planner). The NAV_MODE defined the current flight state: LIFTOFF (often an open-loop maneuver), LANDING, WAYPOINTS or VECTOR. This represents the internal navigation state machine. The system status shows wether the system is currently active or not and if an emergency occured. During the CRITICAL and EMERGENCY states the MAV is still considered to be active, but should start emergency procedures autonomously. After a failure occured it should first move from active to critical to allow manual intervention and then move to emergency after a certain timeout.
message.field: Bitmask showing which onboard controllers and sensors are present. Value of 0: not present. Value of 1: present. Indices: 0: 3D gyro, 1: 3D acc, 2: 3D mag, 3: absolute pressure, 4: differential pressure, 5: GPS, 6: optical flow, 7: computer vision position, 8: laser based position, 9: external ground-truth (Vicon or Leica). Controllers: 10: 3D angular rate control 11: attitude stabilization, 12: yaw position, 13: z/altitude control, 14: x/y position control, 15: motor outputs / control

Bitmask showing which onboard controllers and sensors are enabled: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled. Indices: 0: 3D gyro, 1: 3D acc, 2: 3D mag, 3: absolute pressure, 4: differential pressure, 5: GPS, 6: optical flow, 7: computer vision position, 8: laser based position, 9: external ground-truth (Vicon or Leica). Controllers: 10: 3D angular rate control 11: attitude stabilization, 12: yaw position, 13: z/altitude control, 14: x/y position control, 15: motor outputs / control

Bitmask showing which onboard controllers and sensors are operational or have an error: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled. Indices: 0: 3D gyro, 1: 3D acc, 2: 3D mag, 3: absolute pressure, 4: differential pressure, 5: GPS, 6: optical flow, 7: computer vision position, 8: laser based position, 9: external ground-truth (Vicon or Leica). Controllers: 10: 3D angular rate control 11: attitude stabilization, 12: yaw position, 13: z/altitude control, 14: x/y position control, 15: motor outputs / control
Maximum usage in percent of the mainloop time, (0%: 0, 100%: 1000) should be always below 1000
Battery current, in 10*milliamperes (1 = 10 milliampere), -1: autopilot does not measure the current
Remaining battery energy: (0%: 0, 100%: 100), -1: autopilot estimate the remaining battery
Communication drops in percent, (0%: 0, 100%: 10'000), (UART, I2C, SPI, CAN), dropped packets on all links (packets that were corrupted on reception on the MAV)
Communication errors (UART, I2C, SPI, CAN), dropped packets on all links (packets that were corrupted on reception on the MAV)

message.name: PARAM_REQUEST_READ
message.description: Request to read the onboard parameter with the param_id string id. Onboard parameters are stored as key[const char*] -> value[float]. This allows to send a parameter to any other component (such as the GCS) without the need of previous knowledge of possible parameter names. Thus the same GCS can store different parameters for different autopilots. See also http://qgroundcontrol.org/parameter_interface for a full documentation of QGroundControl and IMU code.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Parameter index. Send -1 to use the param ID field as identifier (else the param id will be ignored)

message.name: PARAM_REQUEST_LIST
message.description: Request all parameters of this component. After his request, all parameters are emitted.

message.name: PARAM_VALUE
message.description: Emit the value of a onboard parameter. The inclusion of param_count and param_index in the message allows the recipient to keep track of received parameters and allows him to re-request missing parameters after a loss or timeout.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Onboard parameter type: see the MAV_PARAM_TYPE enum for supported data types.

message.name: PARAM_SET
message.description: Set a parameter value TEMPORARILY to RAM. It will be reset to default on system reboot. Send the ACTION MAV_ACTION_STORAGE_WRITE to PERMANENTLY write the RAM contents to EEPROM. IMPORTANT: The receiving component should acknowledge the new parameter value by sending a param_value message to all communication partners. This will also ensure that multiple GCS all have an up-to-date list of all parameters. If the sending GCS did not receive a PARAM_VALUE message within its timeout time, it should re-send the PARAM_SET message.
message.field: Onboard parameter id, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars - applications have to provide 16+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as string
Onboard parameter type: see the MAV_PARAM_TYPE enum for supported data types.

message.name: RAW_IMU
message.description: The RAW IMU readings for the usual 9DOF sensor setup. This message should always contain the true raw values without any scaling to allow data capture and system debugging.
message.field: Timestamp (microseconds since UNIX epoch or microseconds since system boot)

message.name: ATTITUDE
message.description: The attitude in the aeronautical frame (right-handed, Z-down, X-front, Y-right).

message.name: NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT
message.description: Send a key-value pair as float. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.

message.name: NAMED_VALUE_INT
message.description: Send a key-value pair as integer. The use of this message is discouraged for normal packets, but a quite efficient way for testing new messages and getting experimental debug output.
